sen.j: 宮城 千賀子（みやぎ ちかこ、1922年11月26日 - 1996年8月7日）は、日本の俳優である。
sen.e: Chikako MIYAGI (November 26, 1922 - August 7, 1996) was a Japanese actress.
Chikako MIYAGI (November 26, 1922 - August 7, 1996) was a Japanese actress.
Chikako MIYAGI (November 26, 1922 - August 7, 1996) was a Japanese actress.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦前に宝塚歌劇団を退団後、映画女優に転向、戦後も「劇団なでしこ」を率いて舞台活動も行ない、テレビにも多く出演した。
sen.e: Before World War II, she retired from the Takarazuka revue and became a movie actress; after the war, she was active on stage, leading a theatrical company 'Gekidan Nadeshiko' and also appeared in various TV programs.

Before World War II, she retired from the Takarazuka revue and became a movie actress; after the war, she was active on stage, leading a theatrical company 'Gekidan Nadeshiko' and also appeared in various TV programs.

Before World War II, she retired from the Takarazuka revue and became a movie actress; after the war, she was active on stage, leading a theatrical company 'Gekidan Nadeshiko' and also appeared in various TV programs.

sen.j: 本名佐藤 ユキ（さとう-）、宝塚時代は東風 うらゝ（こち うらら）と名乗った。
sen.e: Her real name was Yuki SATO, and she assumed the stage name of Urara KOCHI when she was in the Takarazuka revue.
Her real name was Yuki SATO, and she assumed the stage name of Urara KOCHI when she was in the Takarazuka revue.
Her real name was Yuki SATO, and she assumed the stage name of Urara KOCHI when she was in the Takarazuka revue.

sen.j: 1922年（大正11年）11月26日、現在の岩手県盛岡市に生まれる。
sen.e: On November 11, 1922, she was born near the present site of Morioka City, Iwate Prefecture.
On November 11, 1922, she was born near the present site of Morioka City, Iwate Prefecture.
On November 26, 1922, she was born near the present site of Morioka City, Iwate Prefecture.

sen.j: 13歳になる1935年（昭和10年）に宝塚歌劇団に入団（宝塚歌劇団23期生）、「東風うらゝ」の名で男役として活躍した。
sen.e: In 1935, at the age of 13, she joined the Takarazuka revue as the 23rd class member and actively played male roles under the stage name 'Urara KOCHI'.
In 1935, at the age of 13, she joined the Takarazuka revue as a 23rd class member and actively played male roles under the stage name 'Urara KOCHI'.
In 1935, at the age of 13, she joined the Takarazuka revue as a 23rd class member and actively played male roles under the stage name 'Urara KOCHI.'

sen.j: 1940年（昭和15年）初めに17歳で退団、日活に入社、稲垣浩監督、片岡千恵蔵主演の『宮本武蔵』の「お通」役に抜擢されて華々しくスクリーンデビュー、同作は同年3月31日に公開された。
sen.e: At the beginning of 1940, at the age of 17, she retired from the Takarazuka revue and entered Nikkatsu Corporation, in which she was selected for the role 'Otsu' in "Miyamoto Musashi" with Chiezo Kataoka in the title role directed by Hiroshi INAGAKI to make her debut in movie; the movie was released on March 31in the same year.

At the beginning of 1940, at the age of 17, she retired from the Takarazuka revue and entered Nikkatsu Corporation, in which she was selected for the role 'Otsu' in "Miyamoto Musashi" with Chiezo Kataoka in the title role directed by Hiroshi INAGAKI to make her movie debut; the movie was released on March 31in the same year.

At the beginning of 1940, at the age of 17, she retired from the Takarazuka revue and entered Nikkatsu Corporation, in which she was selected for the role 'Otsu' in "Miyamoto Musashi" with Chiezo Kataoka in the title role directed by Hiroshi INAGAKI to make her movie debut; the movie was released on March 31in the same year.

sen.j: 翌1941年（昭和16年）11月26日、同社日活撮影所でマキノ雅弘や辻吉郎の助監督として働いていた、牧野省三の三男・マキノ真三と恋愛結婚する。
sen.e: On November 26, 1941, she married her beloved Shinzo MAKINO (the third son of Shozo MAKINO) who worked as an assistant director under Masahiro MAKINO and Yoshiro TSUJI at Nikkatsu Corporation.
On November 26, 1941, she married her beloved Shinzo MAKINO (the third son of Shozo MAKINO) who worked as an assistant director under Masahiro MAKINO and Yoshiro TSUJI at Nikkatsu Corporation.
On November 26, 1941, she married her beloved Shinzo MAKINO (the third son of Shozo MAKINO) who worked as an assistant director under Masahiro MAKINO and Yoshiro TSUJI at Nikkatsu Corporation.

sen.j: 『宮本武蔵』の前作で「お通」を演じた轟夕起子が兄の正博と結婚した前例があり、「お通がふたりマキノ家に嫁いだ」と当時騒がれた。
sen.e: As Yukiko TODOROKI who had played the role 'Otsu' in the previous "Miyamoto Musashi" had married Masahiro MAKINO (an elder brother of Shinzo MAKINO), her marriage made a sensation and people said 'two Otsu married into the Makino family.'

As Yukiko TODOROKI who had played the role 'Otsu' in the previous "Miyamoto Musashi" had married Masahiro MAKINO (an elder brother of Shinzo MAKINO), her marriage made a sensation and people said 'two Otsu married into the Makino family.'

As Yukiko TODOROKI who had played the role 'Otsu' in the previous "Miyamoto Musashi" had married Masahiro MAKINO (an elder brother of Shinzo MAKINO), her marriage made a sensation and people said 'two Otsu married into the Makino family.'

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）に木村恵吾監督の大ヒット作『歌ふ狸御殿』を最期に引退して家庭に入る。
sen.e: In 1942, she retired and became a housewife; her last movie was "Utau Tanuki Goten" the mega hit movie directed by Keigo KIMURA.
In 1942, she retired and became a housewife; her last movie was "Utau Tanuki Goten" the mega hit movie directed by Keigo KIMURA.
In 1942, she retired and became a housewife; her last movie was "Utau Tanuki Goten" the mega hit movie directed by Keigo KIMURA.

sen.j: 翌1943年（昭和18年）、21歳で長男・省一を出産する。
sen.e: In 1943, at the age of 21, she gave birth to the eldest son Shoichi.
In 1943, at the age of 21, she gave birth to her eldest son Shoichi.
In 1943, at the age of 21, she gave birth to her eldest son Shoichi.

sen.j: 同年末、実兄マキノ正博のプロデュースで夫のマキノ真三が恩師の辻吉郎とともに監督した『海賊旗吹っ飛ぶ』で映画に復帰するも、「劇団なでしこ」を結成して、舞台劇の地方巡業にいそしむ。
sen.e: At the end of 1943, she made a comeback as an actress with the movie "Kaizokuki Futtobu" directed by her husband Shinzo MAKINO and Shinzo's master Yoshiro TSUJI, produced by Shinzo's elder brother Masahiro MAKINO, and she also formed a theatrical troupe 'Gekidan Nadeshiko', becoming active on the troupe's provincial tour.

At the end of 1943, she made a comeback as an actress with the movie "Kaizokuki Futtobu" directed by her husband Shinzo MAKINO and Shinzo's master Yoshiro TSUJI, produced by Shinzo's elder brother Masahiro MAKINO, and she also formed a theatrical troupe 'Gekidan Nadeshiko', becoming active on the troupe's provincial tour.

At the end of 1943, she made a comeback as an actress with the movie "Kaizokuki Futtobu" directed by her husband Shinzo MAKINO and Shinzo's master Yoshiro TSUJI, produced by Shinzo's elder brother Masahiro MAKINO, and she also formed a theatrical troupe 'Gekidan Nadeshiko,' becoming active on the troupe's provincial tour.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦後の1946年（昭和21年）6月、夫の真三とともに「マキノ芸能社」を設立、「劇団なでしこ」の活動を基盤に、映画製作も行なうが、1948年（昭和23年）10月には解散している。
sen.e: After World War II, in June 1946, she established 'Makino Geinosha' with her husband Shinzo and produced movies, on the basis of her activity in 'Gekidan Nadeshiko'; however, in October 1948, Makino Geinosha dissolved.

After World War II, in June 1946, she established 'Makino Geinosha' with her husband Shinzo and produced movies, on the basis of her activity in 'Gekidan Nadeshiko'; however, in October 1948, Makino Geinosha dissolved.

After World War II, in June 1946, she established 'Makino Geinosha' with her husband Shinzo and produced movies, on the basis of her activity in 'Gekidan Nadeshiko'; however, in October 1948, Makino Geinosha dissolved.

sen.j: 1952年（昭和27年）からは映画に多く出演し、翌1953年（昭和28年）の中盤に離婚することになった。
sen.e: From 1952, she started appearing in many movies; in the middle of 1953, she divorced her husband.
From 1952, she started appearing in many movies; in the middle of 1953, she divorced her husband.
From 1952, she started appearing in many movies; in the middle of 1953, she divorced her husband.

sen.j: その後も多くの映画に出演した。
sen.e: Since then, she appeared in many movies.
After that, she appeared in many movies.
After that, she appeared in many movies.

sen.j: 熟年となった1975年（昭和50年）10月に開始したテレビのバラエティ番組『独占!女の60分』では、松竹歌劇団第1期生の水の江瀧子らとともに司会をつとめ、同番組に1987年（昭和62年）3月まで出演をつづけた。
sen.e: In October 1975, in her later middle age, she acted as mistress in an entertainment TV program "Dokusen! Onna no 60 pun" with Takiko MIZUNOE who was a first class member of Shochiku revue and others, and appeared in the program until March 1987.

In October 1975, in her later middle age, she acted as mistress in an entertainment TV program "Dokusen! Onna no 60 pun" with Takiko MIZUNOE who was a first class member of Shochiku revue and others, and appeared in the program until March 1987.

sen.j: 1996年（平成8年）8月7日、肺炎のため死去した。
sen.e: On August 7, 1996, she died of pneumonia.
On August 7, 1996, she died of pneumonia.
On August 7, 1996, she died of pneumonia.
She was 73 years old.
